reviews.review_text: Just the best pharmacy, with the best pharmacists on the North Shore. Wouldnt go anywhere else.
Always listen to what I have to say and questions. Can be a long time to pick up at times.

No customer service. Long waits for them to glue a sticker to a tube. No advice, checks for allergies or whatnot. Told me to check with my doctor for instructions on how to use the medication. Ignored my ask to fill in only one of the items, instead filled both refills and charged me $10 dispensing fee for all items. There are 4 persons behind the counter, but 2 of them are playing on computers rather than helping lining customers. Had to use them again because my new pharmacist is closed today, they refused to fill in the medication by phone and asked to come by instead.

I have consistently poor experiences with this pharmacy. Customers often wait while people work with their heads down not acknowledging anyone, even to say they ll be with them in a minute.  I ve have multiple issues getting prescriptions being told they don t have my prescription until I push to have them look into it and it turns out they do. A few times I ve refilled my prescription ahead of time only to arrive and find it s not ready or the medication is not available, yet no one bothered to contact me. One time I was told to return in 45 min which I did after waking around the store to be told my medication wasn t in stock yet no one bothered to call me. I m not sure how this pharmacy stays in business

We shop at the North Vancouver superstore quite a bit and always get good service, however, I can t say the same about their pharmacy. If I could give them  -1 star I would, and that s why I try to avoid going to that pharmacy as much as possible.  Unfortunately, this time it was an emergency and I had to go to the nearest one asap. I was promised 40 minutes, but after 40 minutes, I was told that I have to wait another 15, then another 10 minutes. Finally after almost an hour and a half I got my medication, but at this point the pharmacist noticed that I am allergic to penicillin and the capsules I got belong to the penicillin group of medication, in spite of that she sold it to me and advised that I just take Benadryl if I feel sick. I called my doctor and explained the situation, he said that I absolutely shouldn t experiment and see if I get sick or not. He called the pharmacy and changed the prescription.  I had to wait another hour for the new prescription to be ready (of course they didn t take back the first one), but the best part was when my wife told them that their service is poor she got the answer,  then don t come here . We certainly will take their advice and NEVER shop there again.
This pharmacy stuff is very rude, unprofessional unpolite, I do not recommend people came here for people to come here. The stuff is really really bad.

The woman who gave me my flu vaccine was very rude.  She did not double check my name, birthday, or the right vaccine. She did not tell me to stay around 15 min or confirm allergies. I didnt want a bandaid because I react to the glue and she kept insisting it wasnt latex which was irrelevant, but somehow she thought l was confused and didnt want one because I thought it was latex, which its not, which I knew, which I said (and yes I understand the very low risk of infection).  My biggest concern was the lack of pre-administration safety checks and post-vaccine instructions to stay around.  The women behind the counter were friendly and helpful.

My family has 10+ years of experience getting prescriptions filled at this pharmacy.  In the years I been there, at least 5 or 6 different crews of people have served me, which means this pharmacy has a hard time hanging on to staff. On more than one occasion I was dispensed the correct medication, but it was dispensed to me under the wrong Physician prescriber name!!  Even after both my physician and I pointed this out to the pharmacist manager, it happened again. The main problem at this pharmacy is poor customer service. A lot of the problems at the North Vancouver Superstore Pharmacy can be placed squarely on the shoulders of the management team. Putting consumer needs first, need to be a key element of the workplace culture. Without good customer service, who one cares if this store can get the right pills in a container (any pharmacy can do this). Pharmacy improvements could include: improvements to workplace culture thereby improving the satisfaction of the workers which in turn trickles down to the customers, friendliness, having Rxs ready when the pharmacy say they will be ready, fulling Rxs faxed in by physicians offices, calling customer/doctor to clarify (instead of waiting until the customer shows up) thereby forcing the customer to wait another 30 mins, calling the customer when the Prescription cant be filled. I ve moved my family to a much better pharmacy where we get much better care.

The worst pharmacy with the staff changing every few Months. Me and my husband are with them 10 years but is going down and down. No food customer service,rudnese of the stuff no control who is doing and what. Only a few of them Asian staff are very good and helpful respectfull and really know what they are doing.Rest are like garbage.Who hire them ever!!!! Ignoring customers and dont understand what I am looking for and where to look to finder out if fax is arrived or no .Very under knowledgeable with NO proper school or what? Redicilous

Michael has always been friendly, competent and efficient. Everyone else weve dealt with is utterly uncaring and useless. We are looking for another pharmacy, because the convenience of picking up a prescription while were shopping is completely outweighed by the long wait times, apathetic attitude of the staff, and having to make multiple return trips for every prescription.
Never ever EVER pick up the phone. They might as well not have one. You d have an easier time contacting Beyonce than this pharmacy, and I am 100% serious

Superstore Mt Seymour Pkwy Pharmacy is not recommended since the whole management restructure over a year ago. Michael used to work there and was very helpful, knowledgable, and kind. We found out he now works at IDA Collingwood Pharmacy in East Van. Its worth supporting his small business for the genuine care his team gives you. The prescription fill time is light-speed as well and the place is a hidden gem.

Ive been coming here for years because its so close to my place, prices are typically lower and because they have later hours- but every single time I come to pick up Im extremely disappointed. They either didnt have enough to fill my prescription and rather than call me they just wait for me to show up, they tell me 20 minutes so I decide to wait since its only 20 minutes... its NEVER 20 minutes. Im already approaching an hour. And to top it off the staff really arent that friendly. I can think of ONE guy, I believe he is one of the pharmacists - hes the only one thats ever had patience and been kind. Everyone else just seems like they hate their job and really dont give a damn if youre disappointed with their service.

Never have prescriptions ready on time and have actually told us its their policy not to fill them until you get there and will make you wait 45 minutes+ even if they just need to put a sticker on a box. Today I had an urgent prescription to be filled. I call them only to find out their computers are down within no ETA for when Ill be able to get my medication, and they lost the fax from my doctors office so now I cant get it filled anywhere else either. Will no longer be sending any prescriptions here. What a waste of time and total lack of care.

Every time I call them I m on hold for more than 10 minutes if they even answer. Wait times are also way too long. Recently there was a fax sent over from my doctor which she couldn t find and insisted that they didn t receive it so I had someone else check who found it. Not ran very well unfortunately.

Superstore Mt Seymour Parkway has really gone down!!! Micheal used to be patient helpful and professional! A new woman took over last year and is rude and uncaring. I had to move my prescriptions elsewhere after using the pharmacy for over 20 yrs.

Atrocious to deal with. Never have prescriptions ready on time even if you call ahead. Had to ultimately switch pharmacies after a year of dealing them even though it means I will now have to grocery shop at Superstore and pick up my prescription somewhere else.
Rude stuff, not helpful, I don t know why they hire that crazy people to be their stuff.
Awful service, staff totally spaced out and unable to do basic tasks on computer
Worst pharmacy in BC. Never have prescriptions ready on time. Even if you phone ahead with lots of notice, still can t get it right. Recommend to use somewhere else.
Never pick up the phone and staff just seem to genuinely hate being there!
